bpcs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Getting Started with the bpcs package
  • Changelog

Reference

All functions

HPDI_from_stanfit()

Calculate HPDI from a stanfit model

bpc()

Bayesian Paired comparison regression models in Stan

bpcs-package

bpcs - A package for Bayesian Paired Comparison analysis with Stan

check_if_there_are_na()

Check for NA in the specfic columns and returns T or F is there is at least 1 NA in those columns

check_if_there_are_ties()

Check if a data frame column contains ties:-1

check_result_column()

Check if a data frame column contains only the values 1 0 and -1

compute_scores()

Giving a player0 an player1 it adds a column to the data frame containing who won or if it was a tie

create_array_of_par_names()

Create an array with the name of the parameter and the corresponding index lambda1 --> lambda_Biometrika

create_bpc_object()

Creates a bpc object based on a stanfit object and a lookup_table dataframe

create_index()

Create two columns with the indexes for the names

create_index_lookuptable()

Create a lookup table of names and indexes Note that the indexes will be created in the order they appear. For string this doesnt make much difference but for numbers the index might be different than the actual number that appears in names

get_hpdi_parameters()

Return a data frame with the mean and the HPDI for all parameters

get_loo()

Tiny wrapper for the PSIS-LOO-CV method from the loo package

get_probabilities()

Get the win/draw probabilities based on the strength parameters only

get_stanfit()

Retrieve the stanfit object

get_waic()

iny wrapper for the WAIC method from the loo package

inv_logit()

Inverse logit function See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logit

launch_shinystan()

Tiny wrapper to launch a shinystan app to investigate the MCMC

logit()

Logit function See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logit

predict(<bpc>)

Predict results for new data This S3 function receives the bpc model and a data frame containing the same columns as the one used to fit the model. It returns another data frame with with the same columns of the new data and n additional columns representing a posterior preditive distribution.

print(<bpc>)

Print method for the bpc object

rank_parameters()

Generate a ranking of the parameter strength only and based on sampling the posterior distribution

replace_parameter_index_with_names()

Replace the name of the parameter from index to name using a lookup_table Receives a data frame and returns a dataframe lambda1 --> lambda_Biometrika

sample_posterior()

Get the posterior samples for the parameters

summary(<bpc>)

Summary of the model bpc model Contains only the parameters estimates and the respective HPD interval

Contents
